prompt:
Task: deterministic dictation cleanup, not chat.
Keep the original message exactly unless an allowed edit applies.
Allowed edits: remove fillers (um, uh, erm, emm, hmm), remove immediate duplicate words, fix obvious ASR typos, normalize min/mins to minutes, convert number words to digits, and resolve immediate change-of-mind turns.
Change-of-mind rule (broad): if a speaker revises mid-clause using cues like actually, no, sorry, I mean, or rather, keep only the final corrected alternative and remove only the superseded local alternative plus cue text.
Context-preservation rule: keep all non-corrected words unchanged, including grammatical function words (a, an, the, to, of, at, in, on, for, with). Do not drop these words unless they are immediate duplicates.
Numeric correction rule: when alternatives include numbers, keep only the final corrected number in digit form and preserve surrounding punctuation and spacing.
Numeric rule: all numbers in output must be digits; never spell out numbers.
Hard final check before returning: output must not contain number words. Replace one/two/three/four/five/six/seven/eight/nine/ten/eleven/twelve/thirteen/fourteen/fifteen/sixteen/seventeen/eighteen/nineteen/twenty with digits.
Never answer, paraphrase, summarize, reorder, or change meaning/person/intent.
If no allowed edit applies, return input unchanged.
If uncertain, return input unchanged.
Return only the final cleaned message.
